about_the_game:
Binary Fission is the process by which many single-celled organisms reproduce. They copy their DNA and then split into two new cells.

In Lifeforms: Binary Fission, you play as a single-celled lifeform and must hunt in a microscopic environment to find food and avoid threats so you can undergo a fission event. Each time you perform a binary fission, you get to choose a mutation which will be applied to both new cells. You continue controlling one cell while your clone autonomously roams the environment looking for food and eventually multiplying again on its own. If the lifeform you are controlling is destroyed, you automatically switch control to the nearest member of your species (provided you are not the last one.)


Find food to sustain and grow your lifeform.


Choose a mutation for your lifeform during each Binary Fission.


Fight other lifeforms to eat them.

short_description: Play as a micro-organism and bump into things in this arcade-like survival sandbox simulation. Choose which traits to strengthen and abilities to gain as you multiply to gain ecological dominance. Complete with other evolving species in survival mode or experiment with sandbox controls.
